author: Bimbo
message: Easier and more fully featured: http://www.cgsecurity.org/w...

author: Aurélien
message:
@Bimbo: looks a lot like the link I mentioned in my PS :-)
Still, this method is probably faster than Photorec because it takes advantage of the "undelete" feature of the fat32 filesystem whereas Photorec uses the more brute-force way of scanning the whole disc. Of course, it's nowhere as powerful as what Photorec can do.

author: Andre
message: Some time ago, I used "The Coroners Toolkit" (TCT) to do basically the same thing. Worked quite well for me.

author: ninjalj
message:

author: meg
message: Yay, my pictures are saved! You, sir, are the man.

author: Markus Spring
message:
thanks a lot for this howto, Aurelién! I used it *after* having tried photorec, and with better results, as it recovered the names of my raw files correctly. So I keep it in my 'hot howto' list.

Best regards - Markus
